performances.description: They just could do no wrong at this show, Hidden among all the other gems is this monster River. Big solo work by Jerry; nice fills by Keith.

performances.venue: Curtis Hixon Convention Hall Tampa, FL
performances.description: Classic from Dick's Picks vol. 1

performances.venue: Great American Music Hall San Francisco, CA
Iowa State Fairgrounds Des Moines, IA
performances.description: The Eyes>Big River transition is one of the coolest transitions I've heard in a while.  My Jaw was wide open during it, WOW!!!

performances.venue: Horton Field House - Illinois State University Normal, IL
performances.description: Stayin' Alive teases carried over from Me and My Uncle.  Ballsy version
Giddy Up Cowboys and Cowgirls.  My goodness how amped the boys were in this version!
High energy opener to an epic 2nd set that is hot!! Jerry is ripping and the band is super tight this night!
Jerry doin' his own version of chicken pickin'
They are in the zone on this date... Recording gets some fuzz, but I think the energy happenin' was too much for the equipment, LOL

performances.venue: Adams Field House, U of Montana Missoula, MT
performances.description: Quite an inspirating rendition rockin' Missoula's evening!

performances.venue: Community War Memorial Auditorium Rochester, NY
performances.description: This one has some nice extra chaw on it
Jerry's pickin a fast storm on this one.
Jerry and Keith slay this one

performances.venue: St. Paul Civic Center Arena St. Paul, MN
performances.description: This hot version from St. Paul is from a very under-rated show that is better than Mosque show IMHO.
A blistering version. Right tempo. Right groove. Group think country!
I love how Jerry tricks out his background vocals on this one.
Perfection...gotta check it out!!
jerry is all over this

performances.venue: San Diego International Sports Arena San Diego, CA
performances.description: Part of a triple decker The Other One Sandwich! Listen to Big River teases in the other one jam… great version!
Completely rockin'
So much musical energy...an amazing version
Top shelf version, one of the best.
Its funny...this was the sound check and I think it was the hottest song of the night.
After the blessed out jam>ship of fools they just run everyone over with solid big river
Jerry's 2nd solo might just be the hottest BR solo ever! Hope they had a fire extinguisher on stage!!
This version flat out cooks with more energy than usual.
Hot show all around (Brent is ON FIRE), and this one has some boogie.
This version just explodes out of the box, and jumps right out at you. Everything you want from a big river is right here.

performances.venue: Pauley Pavilion - University of California Los Angeles, CA
performances.description: Wow, surprised not on here, continues great energy out of spectacular China-Rider
Clickling on all cylinders in this version. Awesome!
Super clean version with hefty rhythm.   Very crankable.
Finger pickin' good.

performances.venue: Campus Stadium, UCSB Santa Barbara, CA
performances.description: Jerry absolutely catches fire!  Killer version
Freight train of energy
Check this
Overlooked: Between one of this site's favorite HCSs and one of its favorite Dark Stars is a perfect, articulate, and virtuoso version of Big River.
Keith (and everybody) is so on point in this twangy humdinger.
Excellent Big River with some Disco flair.
This one cooks. Keith puts on a master class of the old razzle dazzle.
Scorcher start to finish. Keith comes up big, and Jerry goes ballistic in the final instrumental bridge. Check it out on Dave's Pix Vol. 2
Country stomping big river! Nice piano.

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI
performances.description: Blistering version from Alpine!  Everyone is firing on this one.  Brent throws down too.

performances.venue: Field House - Seneca College Toronto, ON
performances.description: Killer version by all.  Keith is all over it, tho!  He is most of this night!
Nuts version, especially for 1989.

performances.venue: West Palm Beach Auditorium West Palm Beach, FL
performances.description: This is a BIG OL RIVER! This whole show is so special, and totally 'under the radar'...Check it out, and hold on tight!!!
The intro is longer than most. Bouncy uptempo version. Excellent jamming.

performances.venue: Boise Pavilion - Boise State University Boise, ID
performances.description: So fast!! Jerry almost cought on fire!
Listen to this, then listen again for Jerry's solo: Come back and tell me Big River is a "throw away" song, cause he damn-well tears it up here.

performances.venue: Cape Cod Coliseum South Yarmouth, MA
performances.description: They keep it under control, and it rocks.
This set is absolutely bonkers, the pace is incredible! Not for the faint hearted
Very hot energy and great soloing, plus it goes into an epic Dark Star.  Forgotten concert: But the boys hotted this one up big time.
Great show, great licks, perfect bar room mood. Hot!
the version from Dick's Picks 7
Raw and raucous, this one packs quite a wallop for its size.

performances.venue: Oklahoma City Fairgrounds Arena Oklahoma City, OK
performances.description: Straight forward version into a great Dark Star
One of the all-time great Big Rivers
Dick's Picks 6 version
Never miss a Big River from Dec. '73!

performances.venue: Barton Hall - Cornell University Ithaca, NY
performances.description: real hot one soon to be released in the big box set coming out.
Perfect version, lots of Keith, slow but doesn't drag
Outrageous version. Takes a second to get the mix dialed in, but man they blow the roof off. This has to be one of the best Wall of Sound shows.
Cooking with gas!

performances.venue: Onondaga County War Memorial Syracuse, NY
performances.description: Great version from Dick's Picks 20.
Jerry is perfect and he doesnt stop.
Rip-roaring Big River
Particularly good contributions from Bill and Keith on this one, and Bobby and Jerry duelling solos at one point! Really swinging version
Jerry and Bob are off the hook flying off the handle going for it! Prime time stuff
Crackling!!

performances.venue: Century II Convention Hall Wichita, KS
Blossom Music Center Cuyahoga Falls, OH
performances.description: Scorcher Brent hi in the mix and standing out!

performances.venue: Lindley Meadows, Golden Gate Park San Francisco, CA
performances.description: An explosive reading of the tune. Maybe Billy had an inkling beforehand and just wanted to be sure ya'll knew it was still a cowboy number.
Every song from this show should be on here
Johnny Cash woulda been shaking his a$$, even
Jerry is on fire as always, but so is bobby on guitar! The whole band nailed it perfectly
Ripping version

performances.venue: Oklahoma City Music Hall Oklahoma City, OK
performances.description: Country Rock. Played with excitement and flair.
quick and opens for a monster dark star < eyes < china doll
1/2 Step > Big River. The run of top shelf May shows starts here.
Jerry takes verse.  I like that.  Great show btw.

performances.venue: Salt Palace Salt Lake City, UT
performances.description: Pummelled with precision
Segues perfectly out of MAMU and rolls along beautifully til Jerry goes ballistic on the last solo. Must hear.
Some down home jukin' with Jer and Keith
Energetic, rocking version from a decent set of Philly shows, some of which appear on DP31

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Effervescent Psychedelic Yakety Polka Rockabilly
Phil
Hot
Keith front and center
Great, long Big River with awesome interplay between Jerry and Keith. Always a great jam from Download series Vol. 4
Another hot one from '73.
Absolutely outstanding Garcia, a couple moments made my jaw drop

performances.venue: Cameron Indoor Stadium, Duke U Durham, NC
performances.description: Are you kidding, not even listed yet?! This is the second best version ever, after 1973-07-01
Faaast & fun! Check out the C.Miller FM if possible,

performances.venue: William and Mary College Hall Williamsburg, VA
performances.description: Dave's Picks 4 version
Brent prods Jerry and the band up Jam Hill.

performances.venue: Golden Hall, Community Concourse San Diego, CA
performances.description: One of those times when an average often played song gets that extra special treatment. You can hear Brent pushing Jerry along thru the solo. Super
Tons of great C&W on this night
Opens the show. It's starts out swampy like Jerry reed on Amos Moses. Check it out folks
Massive show.  This Big River is as tight as everything else.  Spot on vocals and playing.
Jerry shreds with heavy distortion.  Surprised this isn't here.
Pretty hot
Surprised this one isn't here.
Everyone is dialed in for this one!
JAMMED!

performances.venue: Grand Prix Racecourse Watkins Glen, NY
performances.description: Turns typical 1st set filler into a great jam. One of Keith's best solos of Summer '73.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: An A1 performance that just improves with repeated listenings.

performances.venue: Golden Hall, Community Concourse San Diego, CA
performances.description: an absolutely legit big river, awesome
I dig Bobby in the mix on this one.
This whole show is off the charts.
A monster show, always underrated due to poor circulation. I swear the boys are all on mushrooms, and its a best friends birthday.
A rip-roaring rendition, with Jerry ripping licks, Keith banging keys, and Billy machine-gunning the backbeat.
Check out Jerry's second solo
Cool uptempo version with solid vocals.
Super up tempo and thoroughly rocking Big River, can't even believe it hasn't been posted yet. CHECK THIS SHOW!!!

performances.venue: Veterans' Memorial Coliseum New Haven, CT
performances.description: Smoking hot, how is this not one here?! Some great solos from Jerry, good bit of Keith in the middle. Comes out of a fast mamu, what's not to like!
Jerry and Bobby are great here. Burning.
Strange to not see this already on here. The boys are on (as they are throughout this legendary show). And listen to Billy!
Another hot one from 73!
Jerry is of course stellar but CHECK OUT KIETH. This show's hot!!
Sweet version from a killer show.
Mega got version, Jer's second solo just burns and burns!

performances.venue: Roscoe Maples Pavilion - Stanford University Palo Alto, CA
performances.description: Not flawless, but smokin' hot nonetheless
A great version from a great show.
Best

performances.venue: Saratoga Performing Arts Center Saratoga Springs, NY
performances.description: Great Jerry/Brent interplay. This whole damn show smokes if you can get past the lack of a SBD. The Huston/Miller remaster ain't too shabby.
Giddyup.
Hillbilly Jer rips this to pieces - flatout hoedown throwdown .
That sweet sweet honky tonk metalic twang
Are you kidding? This is one of the best Big Rivers I've heard. Phil, Jerry, what else can I say? Crank it up
A strike-zone era Big River. Smooth & prickly.
Hot, hot, hot! Very underrated show
What is this, chopped liver? Jerry rips it!
Keith's on fire.
Real nice version from a top notch 74 show. Very energetic
Seguing from me and my uncle, crowd goes nuts. Smooth Rhodes playing and hot jer. Great version
Was gonna comment only to see it not even listed. That oversight is almost as nuts as this killer version--all out jam w/a fireball finish!

performances.venue: William and Mary College Hall Williamsburg, VA
performances.description: Very uptempo and fun with some great solos.  Good energy.
Man, could they tear this song up or what!!
Excellent MAMU>Big River combo.  Brent destroys it!
Smoking hot, as many of the Big River's are after the hiatus. Check them all out.

performances.venue: Cole Field House College Park, MD
performances.description: Jerry is charged up
Net with tons of Phil Bass, If this Miller board were what was cirxulating back in the day the egypt run would be seen in a much more favorable light
Great version, check out Brent's work on the keys.
Good energy, gets ya dancin
They were really playing things fast at this show.
Overlooked show. This is still 1972 and the band still kicks butt. It's not just all about Europe.
Acrobatic and articulate playing by Jerry
Dictionary entry: 1973 Big River - effortless & downstream. Exhibit A.
Great jam
How in the world is this not listed yet??!

performances.venue: Rec Hall, Penn State U State College, PA
performances.description: Love how Jerry leaps from bluegrass riffs to blues bends in his early solos. At the end Bobby and Jerry are twisting and turning around each other.
Characteristically solid.
Most Swingin Version Nominee
Wide awake
Big River is one of those songs that no matter what era it’s from it’s almost always enjoyable. From DP 21
One of the livelier ones I've heard!
Sweet, jammy, and just the right amount of funky. Jerry Keith and Phil do a little mind-melding in the middle. Wonderful joint

performances.venue: Long Beach Arena Long Beach, CA
performances.description: Jerry is firing off with super creativity

performances.venue: New Haven Coliseum New Haven, CT
performances.description: very nice rendition from a very nice and unique show

performances.venue: Greek Theater - University of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: "Don't listen to Weir, he's been crazy for years!"
Best
Starts out with a mexicali tease, cool version

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Awesome version of a fan favorite!!

performances.venue: Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum Arena Oakland, CA
performances.description: Great version. Jerry plays angry, always a good sign. Check out his first solo. Also, Brent's mumbly jumbly solo is not too bad here.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Hot one --> Cumberland.
The boys have some serious giddyup in their britches for this one.

performances.venue: Community War Memorial Auditorium Rochester, NY
performances.description: Jerry's last solo is outrageous and the drummers respond
Nice pace and energy to this version. Great Jerry and Brent solos too.
jerry tears it up and keith playing the saloon sound
Blazing version, but I nominated it primarily for its placement within the context of the tasty Playin'->Half-Step->Big River->Playin' sandwich.
A nice bouncy version with brent driving it. Bobs vocals are solid here too. There are so many great shows in this period that get passed over...
Never tire of this Cash tune. Jerry's all over this, his guitar motorin' us down the mighty Mississipp'
Solid version, check out Brent's keys at the beginning sounds like Mexicali before the band pushes him to Big River

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: This show is hot right out of the gates! Great Bobby vocals and Brent keys especially! Late summer heat in MSG!
Cavortin Ivories

performances.venue: William and Mary College Hall Williamsburg, VA
performances.description: Jerry and Keith are deft as always
Some mighty fine pickin' here

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: It was very rare for the Dead to play a slow River in the 80s, but this is almost ‘74 speed! Love it!
For a few minutes wembley in '90 becomes the fillmore in the summer of 1970, the way the Dead just slide into a no-nonsense Big River. Shivers

performances.venue: Grand Prix Racecourse Watkins Glen, NY
performances.description: Second solo absolutely rips.

performances.description: Nice leads blasting

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: This gets going pretty good

performances.venue: Indianapolis State Fair Coliseum Indianapolis, IN
performances.description: Part of an amazing sandwich. Out of Mississippi Halfstep into playin.
"74 tapes are cool"

performances.venue: Oklahoma City Music Hall Oklahoma City, OK
performances.description: Very tight and explosive, clocking in at 4:00 even!
Devils come alive. Joy ride to wirepickin' ecstatic oblivion. Furiously active yet not autobahn, deep 80s
Classic Big River heat
Clean, laid back and almost restrained; a clinic on less is more and a Brent keyboard showcase
Blazing hot.  Don't be put off by the AUD quality.  Strap on the headphones and go.  Brilliant.

performances.venue: Soldiers' and Sailors' Memorial Hall Kansas City, KS
performances.description: Roaring 77 performance
Rip roaring
KG ripping it up on the Rhodes!

performances.venue: Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum Stadium Oakland, CA
performances.description: From a rippin' MaMU into an equally rippin' Big River...
Builds to wholesome Keith and Jer goodness
I know there's a million of these, but WOW is this a spicy one. Big energy from the whole band. The audience is appreciative too.
Great Me and My Uncle -> Big River! Very hot and Interesting Jams!
Garcia makes up for his laryngitis with incredible guitar playing. They let Keith go off, you can hear him front and center throughout the whole song.

performances.venue: Great Western LA Forum Inglewood, CA
performances.description: The first stand alone Big River in years and it's a smoker!
Last time played.
Rockin' ver from Late 80's. > from Mama Tried
Me and my uncle -> Big River. Two songs that are driven by the drums. Phenomenal!
I prefer earlier versions, but this is a nice later-era big river

performances.venue: Dean Smith Center - University of North Carolina Chapel Hill, NC
performances.description: Jerry floods this "Big River" with some tasty licks.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York City, NY
performances.description: My new fav version - How is this not even up here yet?
Jerry low in the mix but is ripping it up, Keith really shines in this one, doesn’t miss a note
This is as good as anything
She just walked off the bluff
Brent's keys really shine here!
Love the segue from Haggard to Cash

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Jerry, Brent and Bobby make this a quality late 80s version
In the great state of Mississippi! Rocking and rollicking.

performances.venue: Brendan Byrne Arena East Rutherford, NJ
performances.description: Breakneck pace as it should be, great 80s version
Gallops right along
Characteristically solid
Solos by Keith and Jerry are insane. Really inspired version.
Just your standard, fantastic, "Big River"
Good ol 73 Big River
Too bad this sounds bad, this may be one of the best versions--check out the second solo

performances.venue: Greek Theatre - University of California Berkeley, CA

performances.description: Brent highlights this
Phil and Bill sound like a runaway box car in an Appalachian mine! Heady interplay during the solos.
Yeeeeeehaw! Gets intense after Baton Rouge verse. Awesome.
Big, fun one. Love Keith & Jerry's interplay
wow. mega one w/ Vinyasa flow!!

performances.venue: Soldiers & Sailors Memorial Hall Kansas City, KS
performances.description: December ‘79 has no shortage of gems and this Big River is another one - Brent really let’s loose.
Sounds great and has some serious muscle

performances.venue: Saenger Performing Arts Center New Orleans, LA
performances.description: Right here til I die. Brent and Jerry are staring straight at the sun on this one.

performances.venue: Long Beach Arena Long Beach, CA
performances.description: Brent!
Like the breaking of a dam, this just flows at a truly ferocious pace. Jerry is relentless in his playing, the second solo will knock your socks off.
Winterland, the Movie. Keith & Jerry both solo inspiredly.
Makes you wanna dance all night long, Billy is a rip tide sweeping the band of their feet sending them down that river at breakneck speeds.
gets ya movin even more!
